title: На Украине заочно осудили журналиста Красовского
cleaned_sentences: In Ukraine, the famous Russian journalist, former broadcasting director of the Russian -speaking channel Russia Today (RT), Anton Krasovsky, was condemned in absentia.
This was reported on the website of the office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine.
The court in Ukraine found Krasovsky guilty of part 2 of Article 442 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (“Public calls for genocide”).
“The prosecutors proved that in 2022, convicted in one of the air of his author’s program, publicly called for heating and burning Ukrainian children.
This plot was included in Russia Today, ”the statement said.
In February 2023, the Ukrainian court already found Krasovsky guilty of public calls for genocide and violent change or overthrowing the constitutional system.
Ex-employee RT received the maximum possible punishment for these articles-five years in prison with confiscation of property.
It is noted that, according to the aggregate of sentences, the court has now sentenced him the final punishment of imprisonment for five years with confiscation of property.
In October 2022, on the air of the Antonyms program on the RT channel, Krasovsky spoke sharply about Ukrainian children.
“And it was necessary to drown such.
(...) Once he said that the Muscovites were occupied [Ukraine], you immediately throw him into the river with a stormy current, ”he said.
Later, the editor -in -chief of the Canal Margarita Simonyan announced the suspension of RT cooperation with a journalist.
After some time, Krasovsky apologized for his words about the children and admitted that he was "really embarrassed."
